required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Anesthetic Efficacy of PECS II Block and Parasternal Block
clinical_study.official_title: Anesthetic Efficacy of PECS II Block and Parasternal Block for Quadrantectomy With or Without Axillary Dissection

brief_summary.textblock: The study evaluate the anesthetic efficacy of Pecs II block II and parasternal block during quadrantectomy with or without axillary dissection, in breast cancer surgery

detailed_description.textblock: All patients receive Pecs II block and parasternal block, under ultrasound guidance. Pecs II block, performed at the 4th rib level, and parasternal block performed at the level of the 2nd and 4th intercostal space level. Data on the anesthesia, side effects and pain, will be recorded

primary_outcome.time_frame: The anesthetic efficacy was assessed in the first 72 hours, after block
primary_outcome.description: The anesthetic efficacy is tested by cold and touch test

secondary_outcome.time_frame: The painkillers request was assessed in the first 72 hours, after surgery
The side effects recorded in the first 72 hours, after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Nausea, vomiting, local anesthetic systemic toxicity

arm_group.arm_group_label: Pecs II block and parasternal block
arm_group.description: Pecs II block and parasternal block performed to provide anesthesia of breast, before of quadrantectomy with or without axillary dissection. Pecs II block performed at the 4th rib level and 20 ml of 0.5% Levobupivacaine injected, and parasternal block performed at the level of the 2nd and 4th intercostal space level, and 4 ml of 0.375% Levobupivacaine injected

intervention.intervention_name: Pecs II block and parasternal block
intervention.description: The Pecs II block will be performed under ultrasound guidance, at fourth rib level, on the axillary line, into the fascial plane between pectoralis minor muscle and serratus muscle. The parasternal block will be performed under ultrasound guidance, at the second and fourth intercostal space, between the pectoralis major muscle and the intercostal muscles, near to the external intercostal membrane.
intervention.arm_group_label: Pecs II block and parasternal block

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients who need of quadrantectomy with or without axillary dissection
- ASA I-III patients
- age between 18 and 75 years
- filled informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- pregnant women
- obesity (BMI > 39,99)
- radical mastectomy
- ASA IV patients
- chest wall abnormalities
- neurological disorders
- septic status
- chest skin infections
- coagulopathies
